succeed.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to do what you tried or wanted to do
succeed.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: She wanted to be the first woman to climb Mount Everest, and she almost succeeded.
Scientists claim they have succeeded in finding a cure for cancer.
Very few people succeed in losing weight and keeping it off.
succeed.translation[0].definitions[0].no: You can also use succeed on its own
Succeed is not used transitively in this meaning
succeed.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to have the result or effect something was intended to have
succeed.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Unfortunately his plan did not succeed.
succeed.translation[0].definitions[1].no: In everyday English, people often say that a method or treatment works rather than succeeds:
We tried rebooting the computer, but that didn’t work.
succeed.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to do well in your job, especially because you have worked hard at it for a long time
succeed.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I’m not sure he has the determination to succeed as an actor.
a woman who succeeded in politics
succeed.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to be the next person to take a position or job after someone else
succeed.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Who will succeed him to the throne?
Reeves will succeed Segal as Speaker of the House.
succeed.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to come after or replace something else, especially another product
succeed.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: This car is intended to succeed the popular Fiesta.
succeed.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: succeed in doing something
succeed
to do something you tried or wanted to do
Will they succeed in winning the election?
He wanted to make her jealous, and he succeeded.
manage
to succeed in doing something difficult, after trying hard. Manage to do something is very commonly used instead of succeed in doing something in everyday English
He finally managed to find an apartment near his office.
Don’t worry – I’m sure we’ll manage somehow.
achieve
to succeed in doing something good or important
She’s achieved a lot in the short time she’s been with the company.
If we are to achieve our goals, we have to plan properly.
accomplish
to achieve something
The government accomplished its objective of reducing violent crime.
What do you hope to accomplish this year?
make it
to be successful in your career, or to succeed in reaching a place or part of a competition
Only a few people make it to the top and become professional singers.
We finally made it to Chicago.
Which two teams will make it to the final?
pull off
to succeed in doing something, especially when you could easily have not succeeded. Pull off sounds rather informal
Italy pulled off a great victory over Germany.
I’d never performed on my own before, and wasn’t sure if I could pull it off.
